availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Shackelford (Madison County, KY, clerk)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, court clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Malissa Shackelford in Madison County on December 14, 1865. Father of George J. Shackelford, Edward Shackelford, and Joel W. Shackelford. Clerk of Madison County Court in 1850. Circuit court clerk in Madison County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Madison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Richmond, p. 251A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Richmond, p. 144.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Richmond, p. 474B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Madison County Marriages, Film #000183302, p. 11.
Find A Grave, "Jas M. Shackelford (1812-1867)," Memorial #149405684, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/149405684 (accessed March 24, 2020).
